segments.text: I notice the boy is really going for those cookies, not caring about anything else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool he's standing on looks like it's about to tip over any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her treat, completely trusting her brother.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe the woman hasn't noticed any of this yet, it's right behind her!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the edge of the sink, and she's standing right in it, drying that plate like nothing's wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she's always this oblivious or if today is just an off day.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The outside looks so peaceful through that window, it's like a completely different world out there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I should say something, but I don't want to be the one to cause a scene.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is all making me feel a bit uneasy, like something bad is about to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope everything turns out okay, but it's not looking good right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but feel a bit disgusted by the water all over the floor, it's not hygienic at all.
segments.speaker: PAR
